title: Mac - Firefox 122 - SHARE TAB to other app bug
content:
In MacOS preferences I made a shortcut for Firefox for sharing a bookmark to Notes. I have several tabs open. I switch to some tab and press my shortcut. Everything happens just like when I share manually – either via the File-Share menu bar or by right-clicking on the bookmark. The bug when using my created shortcut is that it still only shares one tab – the first one. Clicking on another tab and pressing the shortcut again shares the first one, not the newly active one.

In Brave browser same thing works fine. Firefox + Waterfox tried and tested and the same bug.

Thanks a lot for your help
creator: pxcerny

title: How to manually restore FF components back in place in MacOS10.14.6
content: Made the mistake of using "AppCleaner" on FF and it then put all of the components into the "Trash". I took all the components out of the "Trash" and put them all into a separate folder. Of course all the bookmarks and saved passwords are no longer in their correct places within the O.S.. I am hoping there is a way to move whats needed back into their correct places. The image attached shows what items I pulled from the trash. The FF app I put back into the "Applications" folder and the 10 items you see in the image I put into a separate folder called "Firefox" and put that folder into the "Applications" folder. Any advice is greatly appreciated. PS: I do not have timemachine turned on so I have no way to look back and use a earlier version of FF.
creator: jpresto9

title: Firefox no guarda navegador / sesion automatica en facebook | Firefox (v122 win11) does not save browser/automatic session on facebook
content:
Hola, hace unos días instalé la última versión de firefox para el windows 11 de mi pc. Cada vez que entro en instagram, twitter, etc... después de escribir mi usuario y contraseña ( o código de respaldo ), y también después de marcar la casilla "guardar navegador". Si cierro el firefox y luego lo vuelvo a abrir, cada vez que entro en facebook, siempre tenfo que marcar la casilla. Pero no se guarda nada por que sigue apareciendo.

Por mucho que marque la casilla, "guardar navegador" , si cierro el firefox y lo vuelvo a abrir, tengo que marcar otra vez "guardar navegador".

Es el único sitio web que pasa este problema, que no guarda navegador y por tanto no guarda la sesion de facebook.

¿Como se podría solucionar???

Hello, a few days ago I installed the latest version of Firefox for Windows 11 on my PC. Every time I log into Instagram, Twitter, etc... after typing my username and password (or backup code), and also after checking the "save browser" box. If I close Firefox and then open it again, every time I log into Facebook, I always have to check the box. But nothing is saved because it keeps appearing.

No matter how much I check the box, "save browser", if I close Firefox and reopen it, I have to check "save browser" again if I go to Facebook.

It is the only website that gives me this problem, which does not save the browser and therefore does not save the Facebook session.

I repeat, Twitter, Instagram... they don't give me that problem, only Facebook.

How could it be solved???
creator: kembus20

title: Firefox not working correctly after I reset the browser
content:
My Firefox Menu dropdowns disappeared so I read that you should hit "alt" button to restore it. It only works temporarily and dropdowns disappear every 5 minutes. And I have "Fill usernames and passwords automatically" checked in Firefox Privacy Settings.

I started having problems with Firefox when I installed "Hide my IP" add-on because I wanted to change my IP address. I added it because I was getting website advertisement popups telling me to buy a VPN. I disabled "Hide my IP" yesterday. And I'm also getting more website popups now. Do I have to tweak Firefox Settings to stop all of these problems?

Firefox has been up-to-date and I'm using Windows 10.

creator: m.dedrick1

title: Although strict privacy is set, I am able to logg into websites, although lock icon displays message "Connection verified by a certificate issuer that is not recognized by Mozilla"
content:
Hello,

NOTICE: Currently using Firefox 120.0.1 "Update disabled by your system administrator" I am unable to update the browser, the computers are from the public library.

Like I state in the Subject, I configure the browser to strict privacy level, and I am able to visit any site I want. No problem. But on all of these, when I click the lock icon on the address bar I read "Connection verified by a certificate issuer that is not recognized by Mozilla." In fact, right now, I am visiting this website and I got that notice. View image "Firefox broser does not recognize the certificate issuer fortinet but I can visit the firefox suport website - Screenshot 2024-01-28 172732.png"

WOW... View the image "certificate issuer not recognized by Firefox - fortinet - when visiting support.firefox.com - Screenshot 2024-01-28 173041.png" for some of the info I get if I view more information about the certificate.

Then, after I logged out, the "Clear cookies and site data" link that appears after clicking the lock icon I mentioned before do not appear.

View the image "UNable to clear cookies and site data - proton.me - Screenshot 2024-01-28 141951 - edited.png"

In this same computer, I got the control "Clear cookies and site data." View image "able to clear cookies and site data - virustotal.com - Screenshot 2024-01-28 141825.png"

So more than one question:

I read other posts where users are unable to visit a website which has a certificate issued by an issuer that is not recognized by Mozilla. Why am I able to visit these websites?

What can I expect of the non appearing "Clear cookies and site data" link I described before?

Are these computers like totally hacked?
creator: u20210512

creator: bb98baitv2

title: all windows close when closing one window
content:
I have used mozilla firefox for at least two decades as my main browser. However about a day ago I closed a window (ei. X'ed out) and all of my windows closed AND were unrecoverable via 'restore session'

This now happens all the time. I may have a couple windows open - I close one and they all close - not TABS - WINDOWS. As I am handling personal finances, academics and business, I cannot work like this. I cannot keep every window I open forever open so that I do not loose another. I am forced to use another browser until the problem is fixed.

I was also VERY disappointed to find that I could not just ask a question without signing in. This is absolutely ridiculous. Just help people who use your stuff. Why do I have to be a member to point out a problem or ask a question? I'll bet you are missing volumes of helpful feedback because folks are tired of having to announce themselves before pointing out a glitch and just move on as I almost did. That in turn leaves dedicated users dealing with a glitch for longer.

I am using the latest Windows 10 on a modern machine.
creator: vicocles
